content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, the position of a particle moving along a straight line is given by <math alttext="s of t equals, the integral from 0 to t, of, e raised to the sine of x power, times the cosine of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. What is the velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="e raised to the sine of 3, power, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the sine of 3, power, times the cosine of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the sine of 3, power, times the cosine of 3, minus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the sine of 3, power, times, open parenthesis, the cosine of 3, close parenthesis, squared, minus e raised to the sine of 3, power, times the sine of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="e raised to the sine of 3, power, times the cosine of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions
